text: The Piton de la Fournaise (/piːtɒn də lə fʊəˈneɪz/) is an active volcano on the island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean. It erupts often, so it is one of the most active volcanoes on the planet. It is in the southeast of the island and is part of the Réunion National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The Piton de la Fournaise is very important in Réunion, both culturally and for tourism. Many hiking trails let visitors to explore it and see solidified lava flows. Trips to see the eruptions are also popular among tourists. == References == Category:Volcanoes Category:Réunion
title: Piton de la Fournaise
